intro: Neolacis richardiana var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited lacis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
